summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Interlochen Center for the Arts, demanding student enrollment records from 1994-1998. It includes a non-disclosure order prohibiting notification of the subpoena's existence for 180 days, indicating an ongoing criminal investigation into potential violations of federal law, including 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a) (transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity).

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and non-disclosure order as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Jocks
persons.role: Attorney for Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Named as the recipient (attorney) for the Interlochen Center of the Arts in the subpoena and cover letter.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a legal subpoena and non-disclosure order to Jocks, the attorney for the Interlochen Center for the Arts.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a subpoena and non-disclosure order to the Interlochen Center for the Arts for student records.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands the recipient to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in New York, though a personal appearance is waived if records are produced.

locations: Interlochen Center for the Arts, 4000 Highway M-137, Interlochen, MI 49643
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278 (FBI office for record delivery)
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks 'any and all records reflecting the names of all students' who attended Interlochen Arts Camp/Academy from January 1, 1994, through December 31, 1998.
A 180-day non-disclosure order prohibits the recipient from notifying anyone of the subpoena's existence, indicating an active, sensitive investigation.
The investigation involves alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a), which criminalizes the transportation of a minor for illegal sexual activity.
The document is part of a federal grand jury investigation being conducted in the Southern District of New York in February 2020.
